instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 15" Retina no backlight
threads.message:
Same symptoms with exact model donor display.
Have been troubleshooting the backlight circuitry for days and even replaced the driver IC a couple times.  All voltages look good but no 12v to 40v boost.  
I DO get a backlight and video output with a donor 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen attached.  Obviously all voltages are OK and I'm getting the 40v boost.
With patient 15" screen attached to the 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> I pulled the donor screen from, I get backlight and video output.  I am hoping for suggestions on where to go from here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 15" Retina no backlight
threads.message: I suspect you have a 2014 screen and not a 2015. Get a known good 2015+ LCD. If an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 LCD works the board is fine.
